title: 旧约 - 撒母耳记下(2 Samuel) - 第 1 章
subTitle: 旧约 -- 撒母耳记下(2 Samuel) -- 第 1 章 ( 本篇共有 24 章 )

lineList.en: Now it came to pass after the death of Saul, when David was returned from the slaughter of the Amalekites, and David had abode two days in Ziklag;
lineList.cn: 扫罗死后，大卫击杀亚玛力人回来，在洗革拉住了两天。

lineList.en: It came even to pass on the third day, that, behold, a man came out of the camp from Saul with his clothes rent, and earth upon his head: and so it was, when he came to David, that he fell to the earth, and did obeisance.
lineList.cn: 第三天，有一人从扫罗的营里出来，衣服撕裂，头蒙灰尘，到大卫面前伏地叩拜。

lineList.en: And David said unto him, From whence comest thou? And he said unto him, Out of the camp of Israel am I escaped.
lineList.cn: 大卫问他说，你从哪里来。他说，我从以色列的营里逃来。

lineList.en: And David said unto him, How went the matter? I pray thee, tell me. And he answered, That the people are fled from the battle, and many of the people also are fallen and dead; and Saul and Jonathan his son are dead also.
lineList.cn: 大卫又问他说，事情怎样。请你告诉我。他回答说，百姓从阵上逃跑，也有许多人仆倒死亡。扫罗和他儿子约拿单也死了。

lineList.en: And David said unto the young man that told him, How knowest thou that Saul and Jonathan his son be dead?
lineList.cn: 大卫问报信的少年人说，你怎吗知道扫罗和他儿子约拿单死了呢。

lineList.en: And the young man that told him said, As I happened by chance upon mount Gilboa, behold, Saul leaned upon his spear; and, lo, the chariots and horsemen followed hard after him.
lineList.cn: 报信的少年人说，我偶然到基利波山，看见扫罗伏在自己枪上，有战车，马兵紧紧地追他。

lineList.en: And when he looked behind him, he saw me, and called unto me. And I answered, Here am I.
lineList.cn: 他回头看见我，就呼叫我。我说，我在这里。

lineList.en: And he said unto me, Who art thou? And I answered him, I am an Amalekite.
lineList.cn: 他问我说，你是什么人。我说，我是亚玛力人。

lineList.en: He said unto me again, Stand, I pray thee, upon me, and slay me: for anguish is come upon me, because my life is yet whole in me.
lineList.cn: 他说，请你来，将我杀死。因为痛苦抓住我，我的生命尚存。

lineList.en: So I stood upon him, and slew him, because I was sure that he could not live after that he was fallen: and I took the crown that was upon his head, and the bracelet that was on his arm, and have brought them hither unto my lord.
lineList.cn: 我准知他仆倒必不能活，就去将他杀死，把他头上的冠冕，臂上的镯子拿到我主这里。

lineList.en: Then David took hold on his clothes, and rent them; and likewise all the men that were with him:
lineList.cn: 大卫就撕裂衣服，跟随他的人也是如此，

lineList.en: And they mourned, and wept, and fasted until even, for Saul, and for Jonathan his son, and for the people of the LORD, and for the house of Israel; because they were fallen by the sword.
lineList.cn: 而且悲哀哭号，禁食到晚上，是因扫罗和他儿子约拿单，并耶和华的民以色列家的人，倒在刀下。

lineList.en: And David said unto the young man that told him, Whence art thou? And he answered, I am the son of a stranger, an Amalekite.
lineList.cn: 大卫问报信的少年人说，你是哪里的人。他说，我是亚玛力客人的儿子。

lineList.en: And David said unto him, How wast thou not afraid to stretch forth thine hand to destroy the LORD's anointed?
lineList.cn: 大卫说，你伸手杀害耶和华的受膏者，怎吗不畏惧呢。

lineList.en: And David called one of the young men, and said, Go near, and fall upon him. And he smote him that he died.
lineList.cn: 大卫叫了一个少年人来，说，你去杀他吧。

lineList.en: And David said unto him, Thy blood be upon thy head; for thy mouth hath testified against thee, saying, I have slain the LORD's anointed.
lineList.cn: 大卫对他说，你流人血的罪归到自己的头上，因为你亲口作见证说，我杀了耶和华的受膏者。少年人就把他杀了。

lineList.en: And David lamented with this lamentation over Saul and over Jonathan his son:
lineList.cn: 大卫作哀歌，吊扫罗和他儿子约拿单，

lineList.en: (Also he bade them teach the children of Judah the use of the bow: behold, it is written in the book of Jasher.)
lineList.cn: 且吩咐将这歌教导犹大人。这歌名叫弓歌，写在雅煞珥书上。

lineList.en: The beauty of Israel is slain upon thy high places: how are the mighty fallen!
lineList.cn: 歌中说，以色列阿，你尊荣者在山上被杀。大英雄何竟死亡。

lineList.en: Tell it not in Gath, publish it not in the streets of Askelon; lest the daughters of the Philistines rejoice, lest the daughters of the uncircumcised triumph.
lineList.cn: 不要在迦特报告。不要在亚实基伦街上传扬。免得非利士的女子欢乐。免得未受割礼之人的女子矜夸。

lineList.en: Ye mountains of Gilboa, let there be no dew, neither let there be rain, upon you, nor fields of offerings: for there the shield of the mighty is vilely cast away, the shield of Saul, as though he had not been anointed with oil.
lineList.cn: 基利波山哪，愿你那里没有雨露。愿你田地无土产可作供物。因为英雄的盾牌在那里被污丢弃。扫罗的盾牌彷佛未曾抹油。

lineList.en: From the blood of the slain, from the fat of the mighty, the bow of Jonathan turned not back, and the sword of Saul returned not empty.
lineList.cn: 约拿单的弓箭非流敌人的血不退缩。扫罗的刀剑非剖勇士的油不收回。

lineList.en: Saul and Jonathan were lovely and pleasant in their lives, and in their death they were not divided: they were swifter than eagles, they were stronger than lions.
lineList.cn: 扫罗和约拿单，活时相悦相爱，死时也不分离。他们比鹰更快，比狮子还强。

lineList.en: Ye daughters of Israel, weep over Saul, who clothed you in scarlet, with other delights, who put on ornaments of gold upon your apparel.
lineList.cn: 以色列的女子阿，当为扫罗哭号。他曾使你们穿朱红色的美衣，使你们衣服有黄金的妆饰。

lineList.en: How are the mighty fallen in the midst of the battle! O Jonathan, thou wast slain in thine high places.
lineList.cn: 英雄何竟在阵上仆倒。约拿单何竟在山上被杀。

lineList.en: I am distressed for thee, my brother Jonathan: very pleasant hast thou been unto me: thy love to me was wonderful, passing the love of women.
lineList.cn: 我兄约拿单哪，我为你悲伤。我甚喜悦你。你向我发的爱情奇妙非常，过于妇女的爱情。

lineList.en: How are the mighty fallen, and the weapons of war perished!
lineList.cn: 英雄何竟仆倒。战具何竟灭没。
